I have around 20-30 hours on my battle.net account for this game and ive been preparing a full review since it was announced to release on steam. This has to be one of the most lazy uninteresting and boring sequels of the past 10 years. 
This game has 3 big problems

1) The game itself

2) The store and battlepass

3) The sequel part of it

1. I donâ€™t know how or why but this game is so boring for no reason. Without friends its draining to play through, even with them itâ€™s a gamble if youll be able to have fun because of the pretty bad matchmaking. Youd get put into a match where the enemy team seem to have over at least 300 hours on it completely destroying your team in the matter of sometimes minutes. This has happened MANY times to me alone and with friends. The heroes are boring and really average. Their personality is nothing but how they are played. Mercy? Character who is designed like an angel and wants to help people. Reaper? Dark costume evil mask and talks about killing. Junkrat? Crazy guy who does crazy stuff. And if you didnâ€™t buy 60 bones on overwatch 1 youll have to earn ALL heroes one by one unless you ofcourse.. want to spend money on it! I have almost 30 hours on this game and im yet to unlock all of them.

2. The battlepass has to be one of the worst in any game I have ever played. Its so average. The only excuse of this existing is the fact that the game is free but youll have to pay up if youd want the new character as fast as possible. The store is no different, found a reaper bundle that had like 3 skins 1 icon like 1 voice lines and 1 victory pose for 25-30 DOLLARS, that is an INSANE price tag for 1 jpeg 2 extra stuff and 3 skins. 

3. This is not a sequel, this is a watered down version of the first game made to appeal with the modern gaming market. Nothing else. Filled with battlepasses, overpriced bundles etc. Donâ€™t even get me started on the whole PvE and skill tree that was MARKETED for the game since its announcement even after its release to then be canceled 8 months into the games life. And now they want people to pay 15 bucks for a 3 mission pack of the unfinished feature that will most likely take like an hour or so to beat. This is beyond scummy.
Overall while the game isnâ€™t glichy or unfinished its sloppy with its gameplay, balancing, matchmaking, marketing etc with overpriced bundles a bad battlepass boring gameplay all covered up with its free price tag. A useless stain on not only Overwatch and Activison (like they donâ€™t already have a massive stain on them). If you want to play another hero shooter there are some on steam rn. This is not worth your time. Thanks for reading :3

Primeras impresiones muy malas D:

It is sad what has become of this game, used to love playing it, but thereÂ´s just so many negatives to it. 

Since ow2 came out iÂ´ve been watching the game for a chance to hop back in and commit for at least 1 season. But 10 months later, this game still seems to be broken and unappealing for anything more serious than a few matches a month.
- the matchmaking seems to be broken since the release
- the most interesting part of overwatch (its original characters) is being completely neglected
- skins are too expensive (especially for a game where you dont even see the skin when playing)
- new gamemode push is horrendous and you cant even choose gamemodes/maps you want to play so getting push as your first game ruins your session and you close the game instead
- changing from 2 tanks to 1 gigatank makes it too reliant on the tank player you get -> team with better tank player usually wins the game
- many smaller changes that are straight up downgrade from ow1 (no time to chat with other team at the end the game just kicks you out, no real progression except for payed battlepass, no earning skins thru playing, paywalled mid PVE 15â‚¬ for 1,5 hour gameplay?, etc... )

Also if you know anything about Blizz you basically cannot play this game without feelings of guilt for "supporting" such a rotten company.

4 Years of waiting for an overwatch 0.8. Downgrade from overwatch 1.
Making it f2p and then charging people 15$ for 1 hour of "PVE" content. Love it.
Never giving a balanced hero, nerfing the wrong ones and just making the game less enjoyable every update.
So like, they promised free pve, but it actually costs money.

worst monetization a f2p game has ever had. It takes 8 months of going out of your way to do every single challenge before you can purchase the battlepass just once. The battlepasses don't even let you earn currency so you can buy the next one or skins from the shop. The skins are now $20 (but force you to buy them from a $25 bundle) and are significantly less detailed than what was free in ow1. PREDATORY MONETIZATION AT ITS FINEST.

It's obvious the devs don't even play the game because the balance changes they do make no godamn sense while they ignore what people actually complain about.

They also lied to us for years about what pvp would be.

I don't understand the hate on this game.
the game is great imho and much better than the first one ( at least they took away the loot boxes)
people here just hate on it because it's from Blizzard which is nonsense.

This so called sequel falls short in so many ways that it's hard to overlook the glaring issues that plague this game. First they said they would improvement the graphics from the first game but are barely noticeable, making me question whether any real effort was put into enhancing the visual experience.
The micro transactions are awful. You know it's sad when players want loot boxes back. They now put everything behind a paywall, preying on players' desire to customize their heroes with enticing skins and emotes. It's sad to see a game that was once praised for its fair and reasonable approach to in-game purchases succumb to the same predatory practices that have become all too common in the gaming industry.

Furthermore, the lack of a compelling single-player campaign is a glaring problem. Overwatch 2's story mode feels like an afterthought, The absence of a strong single-player experience is a missed opportunity to provide a well-rounded gaming package for those who might not be as interested in competitive multiplayer.
 It's also disappointing that you have to pay $15 dollars for these half baked story missions they hyped people up for only for it to be stuck behind a paywall.

Over all Overwatch 2 is a bitter disappointment that fails to capture the magic of its predecessor. It's a mishmash of questionable design choices, lackluster visuals, and a dearth of meaningful content. If you're a fan of the original Overwatch, I'd recommend tempering your expectations before diving into this lackluster sequel.
que juego de mierda se cae todo el tiempo

Got 200 hours on Lucio and got golden Sigma balls/ skins on characters I don't play...F this game, F Bobby, F Blizzard.  Jeff promised us campaign mode for Overwatch 2.  When yall got rid of PvE, whats the point of the 2 then in Overwatch 2?  I wasted $60 on Xbox Live for nothing.  Winston said Overwatch is back.  No it is not.  GIVE US CAMPAIGN MODE.

As a person who has played OW nonstop since launch essentially, Overwatch 2 gameplay wise, despite it's horrible management and predatory microtransactions, is extremely fun and addicting. It doesn't matter how much the Activision has tried to fuck up this game.

The game at it's essence is just insanely well made and if anything the Overwatch 2 devs have taken the game in a much better direction. Overwatch 1 had a complete misunderstanding of what mechanics were actually FUN, meanwhile Overwatch 2 has taken the game in a direction which allows for much more individual skill expression which for the majority of players results in a much more enjoyable experience. The game actually feels like a SHOOTER and each individual player has much more agency. On top of it, Overwatch has always and keeps having some of the most polish of any shooter out there.

I feel bad for many of the developers because it's not their fault that the full-scale PVE was cancelled or that microtransactions are overpriced. It's completely due to mismanagement for the higher ups. It's sad because a lot of the changes are clear improvements. But, Activision Blizzard simply do not know how to do business and due to that all of those devs' time, effort and love has been spent on a game that people will hate for things external to the core game itself. Good Job!

OW2 SUCKS

[i]this title really was kicked in the nuts by blizzard, holy cow. i'll just mention what i know:[/i]

[h1]>failed promises:[/h1] the long anticipated PvE mode with hero skill trees and high replayability was essentially cancelled, even though that was the reason why overwatch 2 happened in the first place. nice. [b]what was happening for the last four years?!?[/b]

[h1]>locked heroes:[/h1] most heroes by default need to either be earned by grinding your playtime to 100 hours or by purchasing them with your in-game currency, which limits team composition options in a game centered around team composition. this also prevents newer players from learning playstyles they are interested in early on. would you like to try out the new hero? sorry, 7 dollars please.

[h1]>squandered reward system:[/h1] the new battle pass system essentially requires players to spend $10, play the game crack-addict style in order to grind xp, and eventually earn items that are set in stone on a timeline for an entire [b]9 weeks long!!![/b] you could end up not liking these items, or not care about them much to begin with if they are hero-specfic and do not apply to you. the loot box system, while still being what it was, was way more fun and more satisfying to use in my opinion. this new system is a real gut punch for casual players who don't spend their entire life playing video games.

[h1]>terrible monetization:[/h1] this game has practiced some awful monetization methods. whether it's introducing a weak battle pass, charging $20 for legendary skins, or locking heroes behind a paywall, this game has done all it can to make this the most greed-felt version of overwatch it could have been. item bundles on the shop are around $20 or more, and if you only want to purchase one of the items included in a bundle, sorry, but you still need to pay for the full bundle. (yikes!) at the very least, the pricing of items has been improved, but the fact that we've gotten this low is just sad. i would like to clarify that i realize most of these changes were due to the F2P model change, and i don't think that there was anything wrong with the game becoming F2P. in fact, i think it was a fantastic decision to make, but i've seen other F2P titles handle monetization 10x better than this.

[h1]>neutered cosmetic features:[/h1] player portraits and a bunch of other features (ex. the "on-fire" system) that satisfied players, encouraged player progression, and gave overwatch unique aspects to its identity were affected in some way or removed for pretty much no reason. 

[h1]>goodbye maps:[/h1] a lot of classic maps outright aren't even in the game anymore due to the removal of the assault gamemode. hanamura, horizon lunar colony, temple of anubis, volskaya industries, numbani, blizzard world, and some others i might be forgetting; all are gone.

[h1]>not really ow2's fault, but:[/h1] the game has become very centered around the competitive aspects of the game, which led to the traditional influx of online toxicity. which again, is a real gut punch towards casual players since you end up being yelled at by your teammates in almost every match you're in. this problem is bound to happen with any competitive gaming community and isn't unique to overwatch 2, but the problem still persists.

[h1]>poor cowboy:[/h1] i'm sorry, but mccree's rename was genuinely stupid. i don't have any form of rebuttal for this... [b]why would you make one of your most recognizable characters sound like a macaroni mascot?!?[/b]

[i]TL;DR: i loved the original overwatch. :([/i]
Works fine!

The game is still fun to play, but I just cannot recommend it to any newcomers. Blizzard scrapped Overwatch 1, completely functional game, for this game with promises that it would be a fun PvE shooter. But after realizing how much money they made with this cash grab, they dropped PvE completely so that they can push more battlepasses down our throats. Now, new characters are under a pay wall (they were free in OW1) and skin bundles cost as much as the original Overwatch. Seriously, if you are new and wanted to try this game out, go ahead if you are ready to drop some more dollars onto this game. Otherwise, just play Team Fortress 2 instead. That game is actually completely free, arguably more fun than OW2 and isn't developed by a trashy company.

worst purchase of my life, too many "hero's" TF2 is way better.

If someone had told me five years ago that a Blizzard game was coming out on Steam, I would have been ecstatic. 

But unfortunately in the past five years Blizzard Entertainment has turned into a cloaca of leeches, profiting from the merits of people who left the company long ago. And Overwatch 2 is another such parasite game.
